Job Title: Microgrid Solution Architect

Location: Texas, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description SummaryOwn the project control activity globally and drive consistent functional specifications and common global processes for projects implementation. Activities that are conducted to better understand or ultimately meet the expectations of the customer Impacts the team's ability to achieve service, quality and timeliness of objectives. The role is subject to operating policy objectives. There is moderate autonomy within the role. High levels of operational judgment are required to achieve outcomes required.

Job Description

Essential Responsibilities:

As Microgrid Solution Architect, you will be

Working with other experts, provide the technical solutions integrating Energy Stor****** Systems (BESS, CESS, Flywheel, thermal stor******…), power conditioning, balance of plant, power quality, grid automation (level 1 to 3), distributed energy resources (solar, wind, genset, aeroderivative turbines…), remote monitoring services, digital (APM and optimizers), cyber security… to meet customer requirements and main drivers (energy access, energy efficiency, energy security, reliability, resilience…) for inquiries received from business development leaders.Provide technical leadership when assessing opportunities upfront for feasibility. Identify & mitigate the technical risks involved & communicate to the business development team.Review customer site/plant information, understand customer drivers and environment and ensure offering satisfies customer requirements. Identify exceptions and/or required clarifications.Generate cost estimates for proposed solutions and established quoting limits. Revise proposals as necessary based on both customer and GE engineering ******dbacks.Lever****** SFDC to track customer activity, driving improved visibility. Comply with defined commercial processes.Support regional commercial operations on converting the technical proposal into a ‘ready to deliver’ commercial proposalCoordinate with sales force to make customer calls and presentations and participate in bid meetings and walk-through meetings with the customer as necessary.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering from an accredited university or collegeMinimum of 10 years’ experience in a commercial, engineering, or technical sales function Operations, or Marketing) related to complex solutions rather than products.

Eligibility Requirements

Ability and willingness to travel 30% of more of the time

Desired Characteristics

Experience with system architectureExceptional communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal, in order to express technical and nontechnical concepts clearly and concisely.Proposal ****** and technical reports writing in support of customer applicationExperience in electrical grid code compliance (US)Experience in grid forming inverter, controls or energy stor******Experience with the integration of renewable Distributed Resources
